Dr. Josef Mengele was a Nazi German physician and SS officer, known for his controversial and grotesque medical experiments conducted on twins and other prisoners during the Nazi era, the most notorious of which being at the Auschwitz concentration camp. He was a member of the Schutzstaffel and a medical officer in the Luftwaffe. Mengele was born in 1911 in Gunzburg, Bavaria, Germany, and educated at the University of Munich.
